  3/** @file    vsip/core/lvalue_proxy.hpp
  4    @author  Zack Weinberg
  5    @date    2005-05-04
  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: Lvalue proxy objects.
  7
  8    This file defines proxy objects which act as lvalues for blocks
  9    that lack lvalue accessors (e.g. split complex blocks).  Reads
 10    apply get(), writes apply put().  Note that these objects do
 11    not hold a counted reference to their block.  */
 12
 13#ifndef VSIP_CORE_LVALUE_PROXY_HPP
 14#define VSIP_CORE_LVALUE_PROXY_HPP
 15
 16/***********************************************************************
 17  Included Files
 18***********************************************************************/
 19
 20#include <vsip/core/noncopyable.hpp>
 21#include <vsip/core/block_traits.hpp>

 23/***********************************************************************
 24  Declarations
 25***********************************************************************/

 27namespace vsip
 28{
 29namespace impl
 30{
 31
 32namespace lvalue_detail
 33{
 34
 35/// A mix-in template which provides `+=`, `-=`, `*=`, `/=` operators for any
 36/// class T that defines T::value_type, conversion to T::value_type,
 37/// and conversion or assignment from T::value_type.  Note that in
 38/// most uses, T::value_type will have to be given explicitly as the
 39/// second template argument.
 40template <typename T, typename V = typename T::value_type>
 41struct Modify_operators
 42{
 43  typedef V value_type;
 44  value_type operator+= (value_type n)
 45    { T& self = static_cast<T&>(*this); return self = self + n; }
 46  value_type operator-= (value_type n)
 47    { T& self = static_cast<T&>(*this); return self = self - n; }
 48  value_type operator*= (value_type n)
 49    { T& self = static_cast<T&>(*this); return self = self * n; }
 50  value_type operator/= (value_type n)
 51    { T& self = static_cast<T&>(*this); return self = self / n; }
 52};
 53
 54template <typename Block>
 55inline typename Block::value_type
 56get(
 57  Block const& block,
 58  Index<1> const& idx)
 59{
 60  return block.get(idx[0]);
 61}
 62
 63template <typename Block>
 64inline typename Block::value_type
 65get(
 66  Block const& block,
 67  Index<2> const& idx)
 68{
 69  return block.get(idx[0], idx[1]);
 70}
 71
 72template <typename Block>
 73inline typename Block::value_type
 74get(
 75  Block const& block,
 76  Index<3> const& idx)
 77{
 78  return block.get(idx[0], idx[1], idx[2]);
 79}
 80
 81template <typename Block>
 82void
 83put(
 84  Block&                     block,
 85  Index<1> const&            idx,
 86  typename Block::value_type value)
 87{
 88  block.put(idx[0], value);
 89}
 90
 91template <typename Block>
 92void
 93put(
 94  Block&                     block,
 95  Index<2> const&            idx,
 96  typename Block::value_type value)
 97{
 98  block.put(idx[0], idx[1], value);
 99}
100template <typename Block>
101void
102put(
103  Block&                     block,
104  Index<3> const&            idx,
105  typename Block::value_type value)
106{
107  block.put(idx[0], idx[1], idx[2], value);
108}
109
110} // namespace lvalue_detail
111
112
113
114/// The generic lvalue proxy class.  Note that the default copy
115/// constructor and destructor are correct for this class.
116template <typename       T,
117	  typename       Block,
118	  dimension_type Dim>
119class Lvalue_proxy
120  : public lvalue_detail::Modify_operators<Lvalue_proxy<T, Block, Dim>,
121					   typename Block::value_type>
122{
123  // Type members.
124public:
125  typedef Block                        block_type;
126  typedef typename Block::value_type   value_type;
127
128  // Data members.
129protected:
130  block_type& block_;
131  Index<Dim> coord_;
132  
133public:
134  /// Constructor.
135  Lvalue_proxy (block_type& b, Index<Dim> const& i)
136    : block_(b), coord_(i) {};
137
138  /// Read access, by implicit conversion to the value type.
139  operator value_type() const
140    { return lvalue_detail::get(block_, coord_); }
141
142  /// Write access, by assignment from the value type.
143  Lvalue_proxy& operator= (value_type v)
144    { lvalue_detail::put(block_, coord_, v); return *this; }
145
146  /// Write access, by assignment from another instance of this class.
147  Lvalue_proxy& operator= (Lvalue_proxy& other)
148    { return *this = value_type(other); }
149};
150
151
152
153/// Lvalue proxy specialization for complex.
154template <typename       T,
155	  typename       Block,
156	  dimension_type Dim>
157class Lvalue_proxy<std::complex<T>, Block, Dim>
158  : public std::complex<T>
159{
160  typedef std::complex<T> base_type;
161
162  // Type members.
163public:
164  typedef Block                        block_type;
165  typedef typename Block::value_type   value_type;
166
167  // Data members.
168protected:
169  block_type& block_;
170  Index<Dim> coord_;
171  
172public:
173  /// Constructor.
174  Lvalue_proxy(block_type& b, Index<Dim> const& i)
175    : base_type(lvalue_detail::get(b, i)),
176      block_(b), coord_(i)
177  {};
178
179  /// Since proxy derives from value type, implicit conversion
180  /// is not necessary.
181
182  /// Write access, by assignment from the value type.
183  Lvalue_proxy& operator= (value_type const& v)
184  {
185    this->base_type::operator=(v);
186    lvalue_detail::put(block_, coord_, v);
187    return *this;
188  }
189
190  /// Write access, by assignment from another instance of this class.
191  Lvalue_proxy& operator= (Lvalue_proxy& other)
192    { return *this = value_type(other); }
193
194
195  // Trying to mix these in with Modify_operators creates an
196  // ambiguity with the same operators derived from std::complex.
197  // Therefor, we define them in class.
198
199  value_type operator+= (value_type n)
200    { return *this = *this + n; }
201  value_type operator-= (value_type n)
202    { return *this = *this - n; }
203  value_type operator*= (value_type n)
204    { return *this = *this * n; }
205  value_type operator/= (value_type n)
206    { return *this = *this / n; }
207};
208
209
210
211/// Proxy_lvalue_factory takes an arbitrary Block and generates
212/// Lvalue_proxy instances from it.
213template <typename Block>
214class Proxy_lvalue_factory : Non_copyable
215{
216  /// The block we have been asked to produce proxy lvalues for.  As
217  /// this object is extremely short-lived, we do not bother counting
218  /// this reference.
219  Block& block_;
220
221  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
222  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
223
224public:
225  /// The type of the reference that will be returned.
226  typedef Lvalue_proxy<value_type, Block, dim>       reference_type;
227  typedef Lvalue_proxy<value_type, Block, dim> const const_reference_type;
228
229  /// Constructor.
230  Proxy_lvalue_factory (Block& b) : block_(b) {}
231
232  /// Retrieve the proxy.
233  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i)
234    { return Lvalue_proxy<value_type, Block, dim>(block_, Index<1>(i)); }
235  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j)
236    { return Lvalue_proxy<value_type, Block, dim>(block_, Index<2>(i, j)); }
237  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k)
238    { return Lvalue_proxy<value_type, Block, dim>(block_, Index<3>(i, j, k)); }
239};
240
241/// True_lvalue_factory takes a Block that implements impl_ref(),
242/// and generates true lvalues from it by applying that function.
243template <typename Block>
244class True_lvalue_factory : Non_copyable
245{
246  /// The block we have been asked to produce proxy lvalues for.  As
247  /// this object is extremely short-lived, we do not bother counting
248  /// this reference.
249  Block& block_;
250
251public:
252  /// The type of the reference that will be returned.
253  typedef typename Block::reference_type       reference_type;
254  typedef typename Block::const_reference_type const_reference_type;
255
256  /// Constructor.
257  True_lvalue_factory (Block& b) : block_(b) {}
258
259  /// Retrieve the proxy.
260  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i)
261    { return block_.impl_ref(i); }
262  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j)
263    { return block_.impl_ref(i, j); }
264  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k)
265    { return block_.impl_ref(i, j, k); }
266};
267
268
269
270// Trait to determine if type is an lvalue_proxy.
271
272template <typename T>
273struct Is_lvalue_proxy_type
274{
275  static bool const value = false;
276  typedef T value_type;
277};
278
279template <typename       T,
280	  typename       BlockT,
281	  dimension_type Dim>
282struct Is_lvalue_proxy_type<Lvalue_proxy<T, BlockT, Dim> >
283{
284  static bool const value = true;
285  typedef T value_type;
286};
